The Afro-American Life Insurance Company
INCORPORATED UNDER THE LAWS OF FLORIDA
PAID UP CAPITAL STOCK $150,000.00
A.L. LEWIS, PRESIDENT J.H. LEWIS, VICE PRESIDENT
LOUIS D. ERVIN, CASHIER WILLIAM H. LEE, SECRETARY
HOME OFFICE 101-105 E. UNION STREET
OFFICE OF PRESIDENT
P.O. BOX 660
JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA
January 18- 1936
Miss Eartha White
611 West Ashley Street
Jacksonville, Florida
My dear Miss White:
I noticed recently your publication with reference
to (the) History Society for Jacksonville Negroes.
I have always felt that some one should write a
history of the Negroes of our city, as far back
as we can get information, so that in future years
the young generation will know of some of the
accomplishments and hardships. You have my hearty
support and if i can be of any service to you,
call on me.
Mayor Aslop called me and stated that he wanted to
appoint you and myself as an Advisory Committee on
the Slum Housing Act, and ask that I talk with
Mr. Bradshaw, who I saw this morning and he
suggested that we talk with Mr. Edwards in Barnett
Bank building next Monday or Tuesday. Please get
in touch with me for this meeting.
May I wish for you continued good health and success.
Very truly yours,
A.L. LEWIS, PRESIDENT
